content.raw: Ah, that's a style thing that I do.  If a function is only required by a single module, then I just put it into that module, no need to expose the symbol (you get a local symbol instead of a global one).  Once it is used by more than one module, I put it in a common place, and then you get a global symbol.  This matters more for C than C++, since we have namespaces in C++.  Still, I like to keep all of the code together unless it needs to be shared.
